intro: Odacmis fascicularis, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Odacmis fascicularis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil and full sun.
